before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"48ise","text":"Fresh blood must be used each time as monocytes do not survive the freeze/thaw process ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4urqo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fh3g","text":"Optimisation experiments must be performed to ensure all cell types survive without compromise to survival, proliferation and differentiation state in the 1:1 mix of medias (T cell/moDC media: cell of interest media) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fmok","text":"The monocyte-derived dendritic cell (moDC) immunogenicity assay can be utilised to test immunogenicity of different cell types. Similar to the mixed lymphocyte reaction (MLR) assay, cells of interest are co-cultured with T cells. Professional antigen presenting cells (APCs; moDCs) are added here to ensure optimal T cell activation in the case of immunogenic cells and improve limited sensitivity of the MLR-like assays. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mtrt","text":"\nAutologous CD14+ monocytes and T cells are isolated from PBMCs. Monocytes are differentiated to mature dendritic cells over 7 days, then co-cultured with T cells and cells of interest for 5 days. Recommended readouts of the assay are ELISA (for IFNg/TNFa release) and flow cytometry (for T cell proliferation and CD25 expression). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bda63","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du7k2","text":"Positive controls wells of allogeneic moDC/T cells and bead-activated T cells are utilised. Biological replicates can be run in parallel. Well-well variation is minimal, but samples can be run in technical duplicates if desired. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Immunogenicity, T cell, In vitro, monocyte-derived DC
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"62inl","text":"Cell preparations: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ngdr","text":"PBMC isolation materials","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dn48a","text":"MACS equipment and LS tubes ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8uk12","text":"CD14+ microbeads for MACS (we use Miltenyi CD14+ microbeads) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcqch","text":"PanT cell isolation kit for MACS (we use Miltenyi PanT cell isolation kit)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86hbu","text":"96 well tissue culture plates ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4f4v2","text":"Cell proliferation dye (we use eBioscience™ Cell Proliferation Dye eFluor™ 450) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d22kc","text":"Cell freezing media (FBS + 10% DMSO) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4b2pu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56eoa","text":"moDC differentiation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fdhdg","text":"RPMI","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6g2n","text":"Penicillin/streptomycin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bprv","text":"Human AB serum ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h3pf","text":"rhIL-4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rrnt","text":"rhGM-CSF ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjd9p","text":"LPS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2p6i6","text":"PBS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpg6m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnnrs","text":"Co-culture ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rghv","text":"Cell of interest media ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fu003","text":"T cell activation beads (we use Gibco Dynabeads™ Human T-Activator CD3/CD28 for T Cell Expansion and Activation) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7i6ho","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3auam","text":"Readouts ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8nk","text":"ELISA materials ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93m9q","text":"Flow cytometry materials ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dd0a6","text":"Make PBMCs using preferred method from whole blood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97tqk","text":"Take whole PBMCs and enrich for CD14+ cells using magnetic activated cell sorting (MACS) with CD14+ microbeads","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8tidi","text":"Count monocytes, then seed in a 96 well plate at 150,000 cells/well in 200 ul RPMI + 10% P/S + 5% human AB serum (HAB) + 50 ng/ml rhIL-4 and 50 ng/ml rhGM-CSF (day 0) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69k7o","text":"\nIncubate in 37oC incubator for 7 days refreshing half media on day 3 and 6 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":15,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5er1","text":"Each media refresh should be done with double concentration IL-4 and GM-CSF to account for half media change: remove 100 ul media, add 100 ul RPMI + 10% P/S + 5% HAB + 100 ng/ml rhIL-4 and 100 ng/ml rhGM-CSF\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qa2j","text":"Day 6 media change, plus 100 ng/ml LPS for activation : remove 100 ul media, add 100 ul RPMI + 10% P/S + 5% HAB + 100 ng/ml rhIL-4 and 100 ng/ml rhGM-CSF + 200 ng/ml LPS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4nc67","text":"Optional: collect monocytes (day 0), immature moDCs (day 6) and mature moDCs (day 7) to check purity of MACS enrichment by flow cytometry","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"123fo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1fbr","text":"Monocytes: CD14+","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fnig","text":"Immature DCs: CD14-, CD80+, CD86+, HLA-ABC+, HLA-DR+","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj2kh","text":"Mature DCs: CD14-, CD80+, CD86+, HLA-ABC+, HLA-DR+, CD83+ ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3gjn","text":"Using the CD14- population, enrich for T cells using MACS with a PanT negative selection kit ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"61qfh","text":"If specific T cell population is required, perform MACS or FACS (fluorescence activated cell sorting) for required population","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bvsb9","text":"Optional: collect PanT to check purity of MACS enrichment by flow cytometry ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6f98a","text":"Stain T cells with proliferation dye as per preferred protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ate1t","text":"Count then freeze the stained-T cells in FBS + 10% DMSO for the duration of the monocyte-DC differentiation ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7i25c","text":"Prepare your \"cells of interest\" (COI) ready to have enough for 150,000 cells per well on day 7 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"entsm","text":"Thaw proliferation dyed-T cells as per preferred protocol ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1oor7","text":"Remove all media from moDCs and wash once with PBS (moDCs are adherent but aspirate gently to avoid disturbing cells) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"p7co","text":"Experimental wells: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61jhl","text":"Seed 150,000 autologous T cells per well in 150 ul RPMI + 10% P/S + 5% HAB ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m7o6","text":"Seed 150,000 COI per well with 150 ul media specific to cells of interest (+ ROCKi if required) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2p63u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jee5","text":"Final: 1:1:1 ratio of moDC:T cell:COI in 300 ul of 50:50 media RPMI media: COI media ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ae9kv","text":"Note: optimisation will be required to ensure both cell types survive and proliferate as expected in the 1:1 media mix ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mfl9","text":"Positive control wells: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eghbj","text":"\n(1) Allogeneic Tcell-moDC","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"555v7","text":"Seed 150,000 allogeneic T cells into moDC wells in 150 ul RPMI + 10% P/S + 5% HAB ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8enm7","text":"Add 150 ul media specific to cells of interest ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nmnt","text":"\n(2) Polyclonally activated T cells ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38k5j","text":"Seed 150,000 T cells into an empty well (no moDC) in 150 ul RPMI + 10% P/S + 5% HAB ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rcgp","text":"Add activation beads at recommended ratio in 150 ul media specific to cells of interest ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fu0gl","text":"Incubate co-culture for 5 days, refreshing half media every 48 hours (day 2 and day 4) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2o09","text":"\nEach change: remove 150 ul media and add 150 ul prepared 1:1 media ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kuia","text":"For cytokine assays: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7qnt","text":"Collect 150 ul supernatant per well into a v-bottom 96 well plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1g35b","text":"Centrifuge supernatants plate 1500 g x 10 minutes then re-collect supernatants avoiding any pellet/debris that have collected ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"50flb","text":"Freeze supernatants at -80oC until use. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":26,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhr6a","text":"\nPerform ELISA or luminex cytokine assays including IFNg and TNFa as readouts of immunogenicity. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8tcj1","text":"For flow cytometry: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3fai","text":"Collect remaining supernatants containing non-adherent T cells by agitating gently, washing the well 1-2 times with the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"br2i7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n0mi","text":"Note: moDCs are adherent so will not be collected, consider that COI may be adherent or non-adherent (it is ok if some are collected as they will be gated out during flow cytometry). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8feen","text":"Perform flow cytometry immediately, including a minimum panel of: CD3, CD4 and CD8 (T cell markers), CD25 (activated T cell marker) and live/dead stain. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ghmm","text":"\nNote: cells are already pre-stained with proliferation dye ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80p9k","text":"\nActivated T cells (CD25+, proliferation dye low/negative) are used as readout of immunogenicity of COI ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: MoDC immunogenicity assay

versions.title: The monocyte-derived dendritic cell (MoDC) assay – an in vitro assay for testing the immunogenicity of cellular therapies
versions.title_html: The monocyte-derived dendritic cell (MoDC) assay – an in vitro assay for testing the immunogenicity of cellular therapies
